dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: (thinks ) Bet it looks like shit.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: It would sell.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Not interested. My family’s still pissed about the first one. I do another one, I won’t ever be able to show my face again. A sigh on the other end. They’ve done this before.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Think about it? Steven HANGS UP.

dialogues.speaker: LEGEND
dialogues.text: Steven steps out of his car outside of a DINGY APARTMENT BUILDING, in the suburbs of Los Angeles. Grabs his bags f the trunk, and heads in through the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The “lobby” of the building is really just a series of wa mounted mail slots, cracked tile floors, and the foot of old staircase. This isn’t a place where someone lives - it’s a place whe someone squats, until the crisis has passed. Steven DROPS his tripod, and it CLANGS noisily at the bot of the stairs.  64.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: (frustrated) Aw, fother mucker - He grabs it, looking up the stairs - AND FREEZES. Standing at the landing, CLUTCHING an armful of odds and is the STRUNG-OUT YOUNG MAN we met under the overpass.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (sighs) Hey Luke. Luke (20's, no longer the little kid we knew) has clearly a HARD ROAD. Pale, sweaty. Thin. He looks like he’s been sleeping on the streets.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Hey Stevie. Steven stares at him, nodding to himself. Looks at the th Luke is CLUTCHING in his hands... Odds and ends, some cash. An old CAMCORDER. An iPAD.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: How'd you know where to find me? Luke just stares at him. He seems CAUGHT.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell you what... Steven drops his bags, reaching for his wallet. Luke watc a bit humiliated.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve got... let’s see. Two hundred bucks here. You hand me that iPad, you can keep the cash and you can sell that old camera. He points to the iPad.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I need that iPad though. I’ve got manuscripts on there, and some personal things. Research, pictures - it stays here. Luke lowers his head. Ashamed.  65. Silently, he moves down the stairs. He hands Steven the i and sheepishly takes the cash Steven holds out.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: I know. Luke lingers. Somehow, this is worse than being yelled at

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I just gotta square up and then I’m good again, and I’m going back to the clinic.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Good. Steven makes no effort to stop his brother, just looks at sadly.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: And before you say anything about rehab - I know what you’re gonna say, and I don’t need -

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: I’m not saying a damn thing. Luke blinks, a little surprised... and then heads to the door. Steven watches his brother go, vanishing into the streets sighs. Looks down at the iPad in his hand, and picks up h bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven gets to his door. It’s OPEN a little, and we can s the DAMAGE to the door frame from when Luke broke in.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Awesome. He pushes the door open. Heads into the darkness of his apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s a SMALL place, dark. COLORED LIGHT from an advertise near the window spills in, painting some of the shadows. Steven drops his bags, hitting the LIGHT - REVEALING NELL, standing in the living room.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: (startled) Jesus! He laughs, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks, I needed a good scare. She stands still... her expression SAD.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shaye booted you too, huh? I tried to tell dad. We’re having some issues, but - did you tell Luke where I lived? You bring him here? Nell doesn’t answer.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You just stood here and watched him loot me? Christ, Nell. (beat) So you hit up everybody. Dragged Luke out, made Dad hop on a plane... He puts his hands on his hips.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fine. You got us all listening. What do you want? What’s so damn important, Nell? Nell looks up, making eye contact. She starts to MOVE HER LIPS, but she doesn’t make a sound... Steven’s PHONE RINGS. He looks down, lifting it out of hi pocket. It's HUGH.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit. I didn’t give him the address...  67. Behind him, he doesn’t see NELL’S ARM COME UP, POINTING J OVER HIS SHOULDER. He answers.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey. I tried to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: HUGH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Steve... STATIC.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: HUGH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (static, broken up) - bout - Nell -

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Can’t hear you.

dialogues.speaker: HUGH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (static) «+. you hear me? I said it’s about Nell.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: I know, I just walked in and she -

dialogues.speaker: HUGH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nell was lying.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Shocking.

dialogues.speaker: HUGH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: She wasn’t in LA. She was... at home, Steve. He looks up at Nell.

dialogues.speaker: HUGH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: She was at the house. Steven stops, blinking. Smirks a little.

dialogues.speaker: HUGH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: She... she killed herself. Around three (static) morning...  68.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: (beat, laughs) What?

dialogues.speaker: HUGH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Last night. At the house, Steve. The goddamned house - More STATIC. Steven holds his breath. This doesn’t compute... he turns look back where Nell was standing - SHE'S RIGHT IN FRONT OF HIS FACE. INCHES AWAY. He DROPS THE PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: HUGH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (over the phone) Steve? Steve, you there? Nell STARES AT HER BROTHER. And just like Mrs. Walker sai Steven doesn’t scream. He just stares back, a look of CONFUSION on his face... As her eyes SLOWLY ROLL UP INTO HER HEAD. SILENTLY, SLOWLY. No fanfare, just... slowly ROLLING BACK until he can only see the WHITES OF HER EYES... Steven doesn’t move. He doesn’t scream. His mind can’t ev PROCESS what he’s seeing... he just STARES. And the RED VEINS spread across them... HER SKIN CHANGES. STRETCHING, losing its color. BECOMING WAXEN, GREY AND DEAD. Her mouth SLOWLY DROPS OPEN... reaching its limit... AND KEEPS GOING. DROPPING LOWER AND LOWER, IMPOSSIBLY LOW...

dialogues.speaker: A SOUND COMING FROM HER THROAT -
dialogues.text: Like a SCREAM, but starting VERY FAR AWAY -

dialogues.speaker: BUILDING IN INTENSITY AS HER JAW DROPS -
dialogues.text: FINALLY BECOMING DEAFENING -— Steven’s paralysis is broken. He SCREAMS, FALLING BACKWAR HITS the ground, looking back up -  69. And just like that, NELL IS GONE. Like she was never ther

dialogues.speaker: HUGH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Steven? Steve? Steven GASPS, catching his breath. Eyes wide and terrifie The room is empty, and he is alone inside.

dialogues.speaker: HUGH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Steve? FADE OUT.
